abstract: The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.
snippet: The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Toyota Motor, the world’s largest automaker by sales, lifted its annual profit forecast on Friday after almost doubling its net income in the quarter that ended in June to 562.1 billion yen ($5.64 billion) from a year earlier, thanks to favorable exchange rates.

headline.main: Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit
headline.print_headline: Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit
